When we delete a workflow instance, it's needed to delete the related task instances.

But for task definition, I remember as the original design(split json), the task definition is designed can be used by multiple workflow, but it seems this is unfinished..... cc @caishunfeng @SbloodyS @zhongjiajie

> When we delete a workflow instance, it's needed to delete the related task instances.
> 
> But for task definition, I remember as the original design(split json), the task definition is designed can be used by multiply workflow, but it seems this is unfinished..... cc @caishunfeng @SbloodyS @zhongjiajie

I'm not familiar with the original design...

> > When we delete a workflow instance, it's needed to delete the related task instances.
> > But for task definition, I remember as the original design(split json), the task definition is designed can be used by multiply workflow, but it seems this is unfinished..... cc @caishunfeng @SbloodyS @zhongjiajie
> 
> I'm not familiar with the original design...

+1

> When we delete a workflow instance, it's needed to delete the related task instances.
> 
> But for task definition, I remember as the original design(split json), the task definition is designed can be used by multiple workflow, but it seems this is unfinished..... cc @caishunfeng @SbloodyS @zhongjiajie

Should we consider this? Because in the current design, the task can only be in one workflow.

> > When we delete a workflow instance, it's needed to delete the related task instances.

I agree with we can just delete the related task definition.

You can keep on this PR, we can just make this alert as `Fault tolerance`.
